item.title: Communication-aware Job Scheduling using SLURM
item.description:
Jobs submitted to clusters or supercomputers vary in resource requirements and execution times. Increasingly, they also vary in other characteristics such as communication and I/O behavior. Most of the current job-schedulers do not consider the communication characteristics of a job which leads to sub-optimal allocations.

We implemented three new node-allocation algorithms, greedy, balanced and adaptive[^1]. We proposed a novel way of optimizing node-allocation based on underlying algorithms of MPI collectives.

The balanced algorithm aims at allocating nodes in powers of two on These algorithms were implemented using SLURM. The two algorithms reduce execution time by 12% and wait times by 53% on average as compared to the default SLURM algorithm.

Additional details can be found in the paper: Communication-aware Job Scheduling using SLURM
